sect1.title: TLS 向けの CA (証明機関) 証明書の使用
sect1.para: In this section you will learn how to create and manage TLS certificates for secure encrypted communications with your &ds389; server.

You may use the traditional utilities for managing your certificates, such as pk12util (provided by the mozilla-nss-tools package), and openssl (provided by the openssl package). However, &ds389a; comes with its own utility for managing certificates, dsctl. dsctl streamlines and simplifies creating and managing your LDAP server certificates.

When you create a new &ds389a; instance, dscreate creates a certificate authority and self-signed server certificates. Find these in /etc/dirsrv/slapd-INSTANCE-NAME/. You should see the following files:

listitem.para: The password that the administrator uses to manage the NSS database. This password is not used by &ds389a;.
These are the NSS databases that store the instance's certificates and keys.

sect2.title: Querying installed certificates
sect2.para: Use the dsctl command to query your existing TLS certificates. Display your server certificate:
